Github

Encoding and Decoding

Convrtr is a simple JavaScript based tool to quickly convert text between different formats. A description of each decoder and link to more information is available using the info button in the top-right of each decoder. You can also copy the contents on individual decoders and download the contents to a text file.

Please note that these tools aren't optimized for large amounts of data, processing can slow down or run into problems once you reach above 150,000 characters. A cap of 1 million characters is currently in place.

Convrtrs

Various operations that can be performed on any kind of text string. By default all changes are based on what you enter into the textarea. By selecting "Chain commands" this shifts to the results section at the bottom, you can then perform actions in succession. E.g. Strip spaces from a string, then select Remove all numbers and both will be performed.

Text tools

Fip text upside down - allows you to turn this into  á…•ƒ±s

Flip Text

Lazy shift a hexadecimal string up or down: 54 65 73 74 [test] becomes 55 66 74 75 [uftu] when shifted 1 to the right (+1) or 53 64 72 73 [Sdrs] when shifted 1 to the left. Supports any delimiter is available in the Hex convrtr delimiter dropdown

Shift hex string

Unlike reversing the entire string, this reverses each individual hex string. 74 65 73 74 [test] becomes 47 56 37 47.

Reverse hex

A very simple method of encription, rotaion ciphers - also known as substution of shift ciphers - replace letters with a different letter at another place in the alphabet. The most common is the Caeser cipher or Rot 13 cipher, more information is available on the Caesar_cipher Wikipedia page.

ROT Cipher

Results:

One of the most well known cipher methods. Each letter of the message is shifted by a corresponding character of the key, running out of characters in the key will loop back to the beginning. For example: SENTENCE encrypted with a key of TEST would shift like: S ‚Üí T ‚Üí L E ‚Üí E ‚Üí I N ‚Üí S ‚Üí F T ‚Üí T ‚Üí M - for the next letters, the key would loop back and start from the first T in TEST again. There is more information available on the Vigen√®re cipher Wikipedia page.

Vigen√®re cipher
